conclusion: Consider forces acting on metal rod PQ and the circuit it forms.
Rod moves uniformly to the right under horizontal rightward external force F.
Force F is sum of frictional force and normal force exerted by guide rails.
Frictional force is given by μmg.
Normal force is given by N = mg - F.
Rod moving in magnetic field creates Lorentz force.
Lorentz force is given by FL = qvB.
Charge on rod is given by q = μmv.
Current through resistor R is given by I = v/R.
Acceleration is zero because rod is moving uniformly.
Initial velocity is v = 2m/s, distance traveled is s = L = 1.0m.
Using equation v^2 = u^2 + 2as, solve for v to get v = √2 m/s.
Calculate charge on rod: q = μmv = 0.3(1kg)(2m/s) = 0.6C.
Calculate current through resistor R: I = √2/3 A.
Magnitude of current is √2/3 A, direction is to the right.
